laboratory_examinations.findings: 430 leukocytes (96% lymphocytes) per cubic millimeter, protein level of 133 mg per deciliter, glucose level of 43 mg per deciliter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Mild improvement in the lymphocytic pleocytosis was observed in repeat lumbar punctures performed at the hospital.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial MRI showed T2-weighted hyperintensity of the bilateral thalami and cerebral cortex, and diffuse T2-weighted hyperintensity of the cerebellum. Repeat MRI on hospital day 4 showed increased symmetric hyperintensities of the cortex and cerebellum, with associated leptomeningeal enhancement and new involvement of the midbrain.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There was evidence of disease progression noted on the repeat MRI compared to the initial imaging.
Initial rapid sequencing run completed on hospital day 11 confirmed Powassan virus in CSF among 2.4 million total sequencing reads.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Diffuse lymphoid infiltrates were noted with no evidence of vasculitis, infarction, or infection by spirochetes or common viral pathogens.
